SEARCH
Package sh.brane.rpc

Record Class LogFilter

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
sh.brane.rpc.LogFilter
Record Components:
fromBlock - the starting block number (inclusive), or empty for genesis
toBlock - the ending block number (inclusive), or empty for latest
addresses - the contract addresses to filter by, or empty for all contracts
topics - the event topic filters, or empty for all events
public record LogFilter(Optional<Long> fromBlock, Optional<Long> toBlock, Optional<List<Address>> addresses, Optional<List<Hash>> topics) extends Record
Filter criteria for querying event logs via eth_getLogs.

Use this to filter blockchain event logs by:

  • Block range (fromBlock to toBlock)
  • Contract addresses (one or more contracts, or all contracts)
  • Event topics (event signatures and indexed parameters)

Block Range:

  • Empty fromBlock/toBlock = query entire chain (may timeout on mainnet!)
  • Recommended: Always specify a limited range

Addresses: The eth_getLogs RPC method supports filtering by one or more contract addresses. When multiple addresses are specified, logs from any of the addresses will be returned.

Topics: Event signatures and indexed parameters. The first topic is usually the event signature hash (keccak256 of "EventName(type1,type2,...)").

Usage Examples: 


 // Filter by single contract address
 LogFilter filter = LogFilter.byContract(usdcAddress, List.of());

 // Filter by multiple contract addresses
 LogFilter filter = LogFilter.byContracts(
         List.of(usdcAddress, usdtAddress, daiAddress),
         List.of(transferEventTopic));

 // Filter by contract + specific event signature
 Hash transferSig = new Hash("0xddf252ad..."); // keccak256("Transfer(address,address,uint256)")
 LogFilter filter = LogFilter.byContract(usdcAddress, List.of(transferSig));

 // Filter with block range and multiple addresses
 LogFilter filter = new LogFilter(
         Optional.of(1000000L),
         Optional.of(1001000L),
         Optional.of(List.of(addr1, addr2)),
         Optional.of(topics));
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • byContract

      public static LogFilter byContract(Address address, List<Hash> topics)
      Creates a filter for a single contract address.

      For filtering by multiple addresses, use byContracts(List, List).

      Parameters:
      address - the contract address to filter by
      topics - the event topics to filter by (empty list for all events)
      Returns:
      a new LogFilter

    • byContracts

      public static LogFilter byContracts(List<Address> addresses, List<Hash> topics)
      Creates a filter for multiple contract addresses.

      Logs from any of the specified addresses will be returned.

      Parameters:
      addresses - the contract addresses to filter by (must not be empty)
      topics - the event topics to filter by (empty list for all events)
      Returns:
      a new LogFilter
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if addresses is empty

    • address

      @Deprecated(since="0.5.0", forRemoval=true) public Optional<Address> address()
      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      Access addresses() directly instead
      Returns the single address if exactly one is specified.

      This is a convenience method for backward compatibility.

      Returns:
      the single address, or empty if zero or multiple addresses
